name: Zig Zag Cat: Dach? Club mo Oosawagi da
description:
Restoring the lands from evil, saving the princess, and finding a way back home might not be the most original of goals; but this game also includes comedy stylings of the Japanese performance group Dach? (Ostrich) Club to complement the traditional storytelling.

Zig Zag Cat is a somewhat unusual fusion of Breakout and a scrolling shooter. During action stages the player's avatar walks forward while attempting to keep their cat from bouncing off the bottom of the screen. The cat can break most obstacles by hitting them, and all obstacles will be broken if they collide with the avatar. By breaking blocks money and temporary paddle upgrades can be uncovered, such as ones that increase the size or the paddle, let you fire bullets, or allow you to curve the cat while it is moving. Several times during each stage a black octopus block will appear, and it must be destroyed by the cat before the player's avatar will continue moving forward. While the avatar is totally unharmed from walking through any enemies or blocks, some enemies and all bosses have the ability to fire projectiles at him which do cause damage, and if all health is lost from projectiles then a life will be lost just as if the cat had fallen off the screen.

In between action stages the player will enter an Inn. At the Inn he can save, talk to the locals, play a bonus board to earn additional money, buy temporary paddle upgrades, and check his progress on his trip around the island.

shot.caption: Title Screen
Run, C-List celebrities! Run!
The (unskippable) intro sequence
Enjoy these Mode 7 tricks, this is the only time in the entire game they appear.
Saved by a kindly old wizard. And all he wants in return is for you to save the island from its evil cephalopod overlord. No big.
The first level doesn't have much in the way of hazards
But it does introduce the Dachou Club
The between level Inn
We've got a long ways to go
A bonus stage. They can be completed as many times as you like, there's no penalty for failing, and their only reward is more money
A mid-level store
Early black octopi aren't easy to knock out...
...but they get more complicated as the game goes on.
The Dachou Club make apperances every few levels, but they neither active help or hinder you in any way.
Level 3 moves into the pastures
The cows impede you about as well as a cow can be expected to do anything
Not quite bosses, but these pigs are the first enemies that can fire projectiles which can harm the avatar
The boss of stage one can attack by flinging tiles
after each stage you find the house of another old wizard, but it functions the same as an Inn minus the bonus stage.
Stage 2 starts out with a quick bit of spelunking...
...followed by a forest
Stage 2 also introduces a new gimmick. One of these doors leads to the next level, while the other will force you to repeat a level. It's faster to just reload a save if you choose the wrong door.
Not only do you have to contend with snakes that can soak several blows from the cat, but owls will divebomb the avatar as well
This tree is as tough as a boss, but stage 2 is only halfway done
